etymology.description: 屮(屮) (chè, "sprout") on top of a horizontal line -> signifies a plant sprouting from the ground -> symbolizes life
etymology.interpretation: The character 生(生) (shēng, "life") represents the concept of life force or vitality, symbolized by a sprout emerging from the earth, embodying growth and renewal.

examples.chinese: 生命是一场美丽的旅程(生命是一場美麗的旅程)。
examples.pinyin: Shēngmìng shì yī chǎng měilì de lǚchéng.

examples.chinese: 他在战场上奋力生存(他在戰場上奮力生存)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài zhànchǎng shàng fènlì shēngcún.
examples.english: He fights to live on the battlefield.

examples.chinese: 这家餐厅的生鱼片非常新鲜(這家餐廳的生魚片非常新鮮)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng de shēngyúpiàn fēicháng xīnxiān.
examples.english: The raw fish slices at this restaurant are very fresh.
